title: Establishes the textbook transparency act
summary: Establishes the textbook transparency act, requiring college textbook publishers to make available the price, and revisions between the last two editions, copyright dates and the variety of formats for a text.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1001

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M. of A. PEOPLES-STOKES -- read once and referred to the
         Committee on Higher Education

       AN ACT to amend the education law, in relation to establishing the text-
         book transparency act

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  The education law is amended by adding a new article 15-D
    2  to read as follows:
    3                                ARTICLE 15-D
    4                          TEXTBOOK TRANSPARENCY ACT
    5  SECTION 730. SHORT TITLE.
    6          731. DEFINITIONS.
    7          732. INFORMATION COLLEGE TEXTBOOK  PUBLISHERS  MUST  PROVIDE  TO
    8                 EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS.
    9          733. USING UNDISBURSED FINANCIAL AID TO PURCHASE TEXTBOOKS.
   10          734. SEVERABILITY.
   11    S  730.  SHORT TITLE.  THIS ACT SHALL BE KNOWN AND MAY BE CITED AS THE
   12  "TEXTBOOK TRANSPARENCY ACT."
   13    S 731. DEFINITIONS. AS USED IN THIS ARTICLE, THE FOLLOWING TERMS SHALL
   14  HAVE THE FOLLOWING MEANINGS UNLESS OTHERWISE SPECIFIED:
   15    1. "ADOPTER" MEANS ANY FACULTY MEMBER OR  ACADEMIC  DEPARTMENT  AT  AN
   16  APPROVED INSTITUTION OF HIGHER EDUCATION RESPONSIBLE FOR CONSIDERING AND
   17  CHOOSING  COURSE  MATERIALS TO BE USED IN CONNECTION WITH THE ACCREDITED
   18  COURSES TAUGHT AT THE APPROVED INSTITUTION OF HIGHER EDUCATION;
   19    2. "APPROVED INSTITUTION OF HIGHER  EDUCATION"  MEANS  AN  EDUCATIONAL
   20  INSTITUTION LOCATED IN THIS STATE WHICH:
   21    A.  IS DIRECTLY CONTROLLED OR ADMINISTERED BY A PUBLIC AGENCY OR POLI-
   22  TICAL SUBDIVISION;
   23    B. RECEIVES APPROPRIATIONS DIRECTLY OR INDIRECTLY FROM THE LEGISLATURE
   24  FOR OPERATING EXPENSES;

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD04728-01-1

       A. 1001                             2

    1    C. PROVIDES A POSTSECONDARY COURSE OF INSTRUCTION AT LEAST SIX  MONTHS
    2  IN  LENGTH  LEADING TO OR DIRECTLY CREDITABLE TOWARD A DEGREE OR CERTIF-
    3  ICATE;
    4    D.  MEETS  THE STANDARDS FOR ACCREDITATION AS DETERMINED BY THE MIDDLE
    5  STATES COMMISSION ON HIGHER EDUCATION, OR IF  A  PUBLIC  JUNIOR  COLLEGE
    6  MEETS  THE  STANDARDS  ESTABLISHED  BY THE COORDINATING BOARD FOR HIGHER
    7  EDUCATION FOR SUCH PUBLIC  JUNIOR  COLLEGES,  OR  BY  OTHER  ACCREDITING
    8  BODIES RECOGNIZED BY THE UNITED STATES OFFICE OF EDUCATION OR BY UTILIZ-
    9  ING ACCREDITATION STANDARDS APPLICABLE TO THE INSTITUTION AS ESTABLISHED
   10  BY THE COORDINATING BOARD FOR HIGHER EDUCATION;
   11    E.  DOES NOT DISCRIMINATE IN THE HIRING OF ADMINISTRATORS, FACULTY AND
   12  STAFF OR IN THE ADMISSION OF STUDENTS ON THE BASIS OF RACE, COLOR, RELI-
   13  GION, SEX, OR NATIONAL ORIGIN AND IS OTHERWISE IN  COMPLIANCE  WITH  THE
   14  FEDERAL  CIVIL  RIGHTS ACTS OF 1964 AND 1968 AND EXECUTIVE ORDERS ISSUED
   15  PURSUANT THERETO; AND
   16    F. PERMITS FACULTY MEMBERS TO SELECT TEXTBOOKS  WITHOUT  INFLUENCE  OR
   17  PRESSURE BY ANY RELIGIOUS OR SECTARIAN SOURCE;
   18    3.  "COLLEGE TEXTBOOK" MEANS A TEXTBOOK OR A SET OF TEXTBOOKS USED FOR
   19  A COURSE OF POSTSECONDARY EDUCATION AT AN APPROVED PUBLIC INSTITUTION OF
   20  HIGHER EDUCATION;
   21    4. "INTEGRATED TEXTBOOK" MEANS A COLLEGE TEXTBOOK THAT:
   22    A. IS COMBINED WITH MATERIALS DEVELOPED BY A THIRD PARTY AND THAT,  BY
   23  THIRD-PARTY  CONTRACTUAL  AGREEMENT,  MAY  NOT  BE OFFERED BY PUBLISHERS
   24  SEPARATELY FROM THE  COLLEGE  TEXTBOOK  WITH  WHICH  THE  MATERIALS  ARE
   25  COMBINED; OR
   26    B.  INCLUDES  FUNCTIONALLY INTERDEPENDENT COURSE MATERIALS DESIGNED TO
   27  BE USED SOLELY AS A SINGLE UNIT AND WHOSE SEPARATION WOULD SUBSTANTIALLY
   28  DEGRADE THE ACADEMIC CONTENT SO THAT IT  WOULD  NOT  BE  USABLE  TO  THE
   29  STUDENT;
   30    5.  "PRODUCTS"  MEANS  ALL  VERSIONS  OF  A COLLEGE TEXTBOOK OR SET OF
   31  COLLEGE TEXTBOOKS, EXCEPT CUSTOM TEXTBOOKS OR SPECIAL EDITIONS OF  TEXT-
   32  BOOKS,  AVAILABLE  IN THE SUBJECT AREA FOR WHICH A PROSPECTIVE PURCHASER
   33  IS TEACHING A COURSE, INCLUDING SUPPLEMENTAL MATERIAL,  BOTH  WHEN  SOLD
   34  TOGETHER OR SEPARATELY FROM A COLLEGE TEXTBOOK;
   35    6.  "SUPPLEMENTAL MATERIAL" MEANS EDUCATIONAL MATERIAL THAT MAY ACCOM-
   36  PANY A COLLEGE TEXTBOOK, INCLUDING PRINTED  MATERIALS,  COMPUTER  DISKS,
   37  WEBSITE  ACCESS,  AND  ELECTRONICALLY  DISTRIBUTED  MATERIALS,  THAT  IS
   38  NEITHER:
   39    A. BOUND BY THIRD-PARTY CONTRACTUAL AGREEMENTS TO BE SOLD IN AN  INTE-
   40  GRATED TEXTBOOK; NOR
   41    B. A COMPONENT OF AN INTEGRATED TEXTBOOK.
   42    S  732. INFORMATION COLLEGE TEXTBOOK PUBLISHERS MUST PROVIDE TO EDUCA-
   43  TIONAL INSTITUTIONS. 1. TO THE EXTENT PRACTICABLE, AN APPROVED  INSTITU-
   44  TION  OF HIGHER EDUCATION SHALL ENCOURAGE FACULTY MEMBERS OR ADOPTERS TO
   45  PLACE THEIR INITIAL ORDERS FOR COLLEGE TEXTBOOKS  WITH  SUFFICIENT  TIME
   46  FOR  THE  CAMPUS  BOOKSTORE  TO  FACTOR  SUCH  INFORMATION  INTO STUDENT
   47  BUYBACK, RESEARCH THE AVAILABILITY OF THE COURSE MATERIAL, AND EXCHANGE,
   48  WHEN APPROPRIATE, RELEVANT INFORMATION WITH FACULTY TO SUPPORT EFFECTIVE
   49  USE OF COURSE MATERIALS SUCH AS BUNDLES AND TO PROMOTE COST EFFICIENCIES
   50  FOR STUDENTS.
   51    2. EACH PUBLISHER OF COLLEGE TEXTBOOKS SHALL  PROVIDE,  UPON  REQUEST,
   52  THE  FOLLOWING INFORMATION TO FACULTY MEMBERS OR ADOPTERS AT AN APPROVED
   53  INSTITUTION OF HIGHER  EDUCATION,  WHENEVER  THE  PUBLISHER  PROVIDES  A
   54  FACULTY  MEMBER  OR  ADOPTER  WITH  INFORMATION  ABOUT  THE  PUBLISHER'S
   55  PRODUCTS:

       A. 1001                             3

    1    A. THE PRICE AT WHICH THE PUBLISHER WOULD MAKE THE PRODUCTS  AVAILABLE
    2  TO THE CAMPUS BOOKSTORE;
    3    B.  THE SUBSTANTIAL CONTENT REVISIONS FOR SUCH PRODUCTS MADE BETWEEN A
    4  CURRENT TEXTBOOK EDITION AND THE PREVIOUS EDITION, IF ANY;
    5    C. THE COPYRIGHT DATES OF ALL PREVIOUS EDITIONS OF SUCH COLLEGE  TEXT-
    6  BOOK IN THE PRECEDING TEN YEARS, IF ANY; AND
    7    D.  WHETHER  THE PRODUCTS ARE AVAILABLE IN ANY OTHER FORMAT, INCLUDING
    8  PAPERBACK AND UNBOUND, AND THE PRICE AT WHICH THE PUBLISHER  WOULD  MAKE
    9  THE PRODUCTS IN THE OTHER FORMATS AVAILABLE TO THE CAMPUS BOOKSTORE.
   10    3.  A  PUBLISHER  THAT  SELLS  A COLLEGE TEXTBOOK AND ANY SUPPLEMENTAL
   11  MATERIAL ACCOMPANYING SUCH COLLEGE TEXTBOOK AS  A  SINGLE  BUNDLE  SHALL
   12  ALSO  MAKE AVAILABLE THE COLLEGE TEXTBOOK AND EACH SUPPLEMENTAL MATERIAL
   13  AS SEPARATE AND UNBUNDLED ITEMS, EACH SEPARATELY PRICED.
   14    S 733. USING UNDISBURSED FINANCIAL AID TO  PURCHASE  TEXTBOOKS.  WHERE
   15  EXISTING  TECHNOLOGY  AND CONTRACTS MAKE IT FEASIBLE, AN APPROVED PUBLIC
   16  INSTITUTION OF HIGHER EDUCATION SHALL  DEVELOP  A  POLICY  THAT  PERMITS
   17  STUDENTS TO USE FINANCIAL AID THAT HAS NOT BEEN DISBURSED FOR TUITION OR
   18  FEES  TO  PURCHASE REQUIRED TEXTBOOKS FOR COURSES TAUGHT AT THE INSTITU-
   19  TION AT STORES ON THE CAMPUS OF THE INSTITUTION.
   20    S 734. SEVERABILITY. IF ANY CLAUSE, SENTENCE, PARAGRAPH, OR SECTION OF
   21  THIS ARTICLE SHALL BE ADJUDGED BY ANY COURT OF COMPETENT JURISDICTION TO
   22  BE INVALID AND AFTER EXHAUSTION OF  ALL  FURTHER  JUDICIAL  REVIEW,  THE
   23  JUDGMENT  SHALL  NOT AFFECT, IMPAIR OR INVALIDATE THE REMAINDER THEREOF,
   24  BUT SHALL BE CONFINED IN ITS OPERATION TO THE  CLAUSE,  SENTENCE,  PARA-
   25  GRAPH,  OR  SECTION OF THIS ARTICLE DIRECTLY INVOLVED IN THE CONTROVERSY
   26  IN WHICH THE JUDGMENT SHALL HAVE BEEN RENDERED. THE PROVISIONS  OF  THIS
   27  SECTION  SHALL  APPLY  TO  ALL  SECTIONS  OF  THIS  ARTICLE EXCEPT THOSE
   28  SECTIONS WHICH ARE EXPRESSLY SUBJECT TO SEPARATE SEVERABILITY PROVISIONS
   29  CONTAINED HEREINBEFORE IN THIS ARTICLE.
   30    S 2. This act shall take effect on the first of July  next  succeeding
   31  the date on which it shall have become a law.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the education law, in relation to establishing the textbook transparency act
